Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull and relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Maryracing
Reviews.Content: Beautifull views, great prices. The suroundings were breath taking. The hotel itself was beautifull with friendly staff. Everything was fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Kahnno
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a spectacular view to the sea and is very good if you want to be relaxed and disconnect from the hectic life.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & Friendly Location.”
Reviews.Author: Fjtorres
Reviews.Content: If your heading for the the Southwest area of Puerto Rico, there is a nice spot near the Cabo Rojo lighthouse and Playuela Beach or Playa Sucia. Bahia Salinas is a certified Parador by the Puerto Rico Tourism Company. I stay here for a special promotion package and for the price I pay it was a great deal. Have two great pools( one for adults and children's and the other for kids) with lots of great furniture and gazebos. The hotel is surrounded by mangrove so the smell and the mosquitos are present. You need to get a car to go to the local stores or to Boqueron where you can see some nightlife. Must improve the food in the rest and also the breakfast buffet because is limited. A/C in room was really noisy.

Reviews.Title: “If you want peace and quiet, this is it!”
Reviews.Author: gayle1234757
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 8 nights in this beautiful place along with my family who lives in Bayamon. My grandkids loved the kids pool (only 18inches deep) and the serenity pool was a calming and serene as the waters on the beach. The service in the spa and front desk, bar and restaurant was very good. The service from the kitchen very slow. Don't be hungry and expect to eat soon. But, the food when it did come from the kitchen was superb! The rooms were very clean. This place is out in nowhere which is what we wanted. Away from the tourists and crowds. I would rate the entire experience a B+ - A-.....no place is perfect. We will definately go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: JorgeKrypto
Reviews.Content: I love it! Pros- Romantic, Great Service, Great Restaurant, Great Admosphere, Beatiful Surrondings, Free Parking, Pool for kids and for adults,Good and honest staff. My gf lost her phone while we where in the middle of the saturday night party and the other they wen we went looking for it the staff from the front desk had it and give it to us :D .... +,- In the middle of nowhere(super peaceful, but got to drive for a while to eat somewhere else), we had like 16 cable channels only, restaurant can have some flyes or ants because is literally on the beach side (that was never a problem), at times the staff multi-task and you got to wait to be attended (bartenders work the tables sometimes wen dinner rush) but they always serve with a smile. 3 hour drive from San Juan, just 15 minutes from Mayaguez. Cons- No Wifi, the water from the shower took like 10 minutes to get warm. Overall- I want to comeback, i was great when you get pass those details i just gave, because i just wanted to have a relax weekend, eat good and have a romantic getaway with a smile... I totally recomend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Rafaelfeldmann
Reviews.Content: I'm not of capable of commenting about the hotel because I've only had lunch there. But, regarding the restaurant, it was great. Awesome. Don't miss it and don't miss playa sucia also (very near from there).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lunch on the Water”
Reviews.Author: roycharles
Reviews.Content: We spotted this charming little spot during a "roaming around" drive afternoon in southwest Puerto Rico. We did not use the hotel, but did lunch in the restaurant, where we sat al fresco along the bay side. The area has a 40 years ago "Key West" feel to it.....it is fairly bucolic......looks like good Tarpon fishing waters.....clumps of mangroves growing out of the water and just a perfect spot. We had great January weather.....perfect temperature....nice breeze.....low humidity.....the restaurant is a wooden structure, terraced from an indoor setting to an outdoor patio and then a water side sitting/eating area also. The service is gracious, friendly, and leisurely and the food was very good. We ate simply.....seven bean soup, caesar salads, a PiÃ±a Colada, Puerto Rican Coffee......it was a really pleasant and satisfying two hours spent and a satisfying meal. I can recommend the restaurant without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the ammenities offered”
Reviews.Author: Ike20
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service. We paid 308 dollars per night to stay in a ok resort. It is very small resort close to playa sucia(q gorgeous beach) but in the middle of nowhere. We book through booking.com and the rate we initially got (180$) wasn't kept. There was no warm water in the rooms. The hotel restaurant dinning tables had ants.In addition there were couple of sreet dogs hanging in the restaurant area. The beach towels were very old. Will not stay again at these resort.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: RBeals
Reviews.Content: Good restaurant with personal touches, over priced. newer rooms are better than the older ones. Our review is a little tainted as we arrived a day before hurricane Irene hit the island. Relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: arenasfors
Reviews.Content: I have being there 4 times and every time is a good experience. Clean, calm place to forget about you busy life. The restaurant is great!!!! Food quality excellent. Employees are there to help you anytime. Everybody have a smile... Near the hotel there are espectacular views, a sea salt procesing center, and beautiful beaches. I trully recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Away From the Tourist Traps!!!”
Reviews.Author: LynnIndiana
Reviews.Content: My review is a bit late, but better late than never. My husband and I stayed here at end of March 2011. Small resort with personal attention. We booked a regular room for part of our stay and a oceanview suite for the latter half due to availability. Upon our arrival we were suprised to learn that there was a cancellation and the gal at the check-in desk held a suite for us for our entire stay of 9 days!!! Area definitely off the beaten path, quiet, unbelievable infinity pool,seperate kids pool, one of the best beaches on the island at the end of the road about 2 minutes away with a lighthouse and very cool hiking path, turquoise blue water to die for. The suits are perfect oceanviews, very clean and quiet. Outdoor bar with restaurant was steps from the ocean with a inside area as well. You could purchase meal passes for breakfast and dinner with room charge which my husband and I decided to do since resort was a bit of a drive from area restaurants. Food was very good, ceviche yummo, grouper even better,never disappointed in a meal. Breakfast buffet was nice as well sitting by the water every morning. There is a white and yellow parrot named Salina by the welcome office who is out during the day who made my mornings, she talks and will let you pet her with a little patients. Great wildlife viewing, as the resort is on a protected mangrove wildlife area, lots of sea birds and reptiles. Staff friendlier than any we have encountered in our travels. Joel at the bar and restaurant was our favorite, such a kind soul, always a smile and full of helpful info, we tipped heavily for such personal and kind service. Owner of the resort was always present and a very sweet lady. Night before we left, the owner and Joel gave us a bottle of Puerto Rican rum and a few other gifts to say goodbye, how cool is that!!! We felt very welcome here and recommend this place to anyone who loves the ocean, personal attention, great food,romance and quiet!! Best thing we took away from this vacation was the memories of the smiling faces of all the staff, the personal attention and the new life we made on our vacation here!! Yes, we conceived our first child there and got a great suprise a month after returning home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, beautiful pool and grounds, nice restaurant”
Reviews.Author: alb32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The infinity pool is beautiful and very relaxing, and the little canopy beds everywhere are romantic The rooms are basic, but they were clean and functional. It is close to Playa Sucia, which is the most beautiful beach I have ever seen - just stunning. The on site restaurant was nice also, which was a big relief since there isn't really anywhere else to go for dinner nearby. Both times we did have to walk into the kitchen area to announce our presence (we were the only people there), but once we did that we received good service. The food was pretty good. Yes, there are little biting bugs that come out at dusk, but I was able to purchase a can of OFF at the front desk which helped immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to any bad reviews about this place - it's paradise with a smile”
Reviews.Author: bicycle53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Bahia Salinas for the past four years in our 9 years coming to Puerto Rico. Thankfully we were told about it from locals. It IS clean, the staff, Erica and Jessenia, Joel, and the owners are wonderful. So peaceful, truly wonderful. I can't think of what they leave out. We've traveled all over the world and we've stayed in the best. Many do not have the natural beauty that this place has. We're going back this winter. If you are looking for filling your senses with the beauty of the island, water, warmth - you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing scenery and grounds!”
Reviews.Author: trishv719
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at bahia salinas from Thurs, Aug 11th-Tues, Aug 16th. When you arrive there's a big WOW factor when you see the grounds and the scenery. Very "off the beaten path" and secluded with a beautiful infinity pool (with waterfall), lush lounge chairs, and even a cute white parrot that says hola as you go to the lobby for check in. It's a little difficult to get there (3 1/2 hours from San Juan airport) but if you are looking for a place that's relaxing, quiet, without the hustle & bustle of the metro area, this is the place to go. Now the title is a little bit misguiding since it's more of a budget friendly hotel than a resort. The package we got was a villa with full breakfast and dinner. Room was ok, needs to be updated/renovated and needs a vanity space. Breakfast is great, especially with the puertorican style coffee with hot milk. Dinner only includes the main entree. No appetizer, dessert or drinks other than tap water, so don't think it's all inclusive, you will spend some money. The food is very very good on the weekdays and amazing on the weekends (buffet dinner). Their buffet is high quality puertorican food. For buffet service you do not serve the hot food yourself, they control it. I didn't like the hot food male server at the breakfast buffet, he made comments when I went for a second helping of plantains...made me feel uncomfortable about asking for seconds at a buffet....?....The waiters on the other hand were excellent, felt like we had known them for years, gave tips on where to go when we wanted to explore the area and go dancing. The staff was very friendly, always smiling and ready to help. However, one day my room was not made up, even after mentioning it to the front desk staff at the lobby. I found it really strange that there are no phones in the rooms, so if you need something or have a complaint you have to go downstairs to the lobby, or call from your cellphone. There are many many mosquitos, please bring OFF, otherwise you will not enjoy it, the restaurant area is open air and I got over 20 bites the first night at dinner! Playa Sucia is very near by, best beach on the island in my opinion. We took advantage of the spa, the masseuse was very good. Overall it's a very nice place, I would definitely go again (with OFF!).

Reviews.Title: “Great vacations in a paradise place.”
Reviews.Author: Lisamari6
Reviews.Content: Great hospitality. The people in this place is like a FAMILY. Excellent service. The rooms very clean. The location is excellent. You feel like in other island. The place is to rest, totally. I like best the silence in the place and the least is the distance from the town. But is great. I like it. Excellent prices.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Valricolady
Reviews.Content: Stay away from BAHIA SALINAS in Cabo Rojo. This place is a dump and misrepresented. They advertise as a resort and spa but it is actually a worn down Parador. The rooms are small and smelly with lots of mosquitos. It's not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A honeymoon to remember for life”
Reviews.Author: Kwametrade
Reviews.Content: The ambiance is second to none. I told my wife about this place months ago. After a 3 hour drive from San Juan we arrived in our honeymoon paradise. We just love the place. Service is great. El Combate beach is great. We plan on going back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent, Service is Exellent!”
Reviews.Author: Kombatlion
Reviews.Content: I have stay here a lot because of work and I like it a lot, location is far from town but is very beautiful close to the nicest beach in Cabo Rojo. The staff is friendly and caring. The only area they need to fix is the TV are old and cable sucks!, internet don't reach the rooms need some improvement there!

Reviews.Title: “A very romantic and peaceful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Simara
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for four days on this hotel last week and I must say we loved it. The place is beautiful and it's very well kept. The infinity pool and comfortable seats and beds by the pool are a big plus. The rate we got at $80 dollars a night including taxes and buffet for two every morning was an excellent value. The rooms are ok. The beds are not super comfortable (too hard) and the tvs are a little outdated but that's really no big deal. The staff was very friendly and by the second day they all knew the room we were staying and greeted us every morning. The breakfast buffet was very good and the restaurant overlooks the beach. Every afternoon we would make sure to be at the pool and watch the best sunsets I've seen in a very long time. This place is peaceful, serene and so so so romantic. I do have some suggestions for improvement: control the mosquitoes (after 7:30pm you are either in your room or eaten alive by mosquitoes), some lively music by the pool bar would be great and fumigation ( we saw some roaches outside of our room). Things we loved: great free coffee in the room, inexpensive snacks available at the reception area, free wifi internet, amazing pool and very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “relax, beautiful sunset, good workout(kayak&bicycle)”
Reviews.Author: maria1103
Reviews.Content: amazing views and ecological friendly. all the staff are very friendly. the lighthouse, the beach and the dry forest...amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - amazing experience, will definitely be back again!”
Reviews.Author: vanilla_bean01
Reviews.Content: We rented a car in San Juan and spent a few days driving around the island - we had booked ahead of time through Expedia and weren't sure what to expect. However, Bahia Salinas more than exceeded our expectations. It's a long drive to get there but absolutely worth it! Excellent staff - everyone was very friendly and approachable in spite of our lack of Spanish skills :-) My husband and I both thought the food at their restaurant was the best we'd had on our trip. The infinity pool was breathtaking and we enjoyed swimming while watching the sun set over the ocean! Room was clean and well kept but still had a beach "atmosphere". We loved everything about this place, right down to the free wireless, shampoo and tasty PR coffee in the rooms! We agreed that next time we visit Puerto Rico, we'll definitely be spending a few days here again.

Reviews.Title: “I came for Business and decided to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: PRBusiness
Reviews.Content: I recently came to this side of the island for local business meetings and decided to bring my family along. My wife has family close to the resort and while I attended to my work, she had the opportunity to visit them..Turns out that as soon as I arrived to the hotel with her and my daughters, there was no leaving! She was absolutely blown away with this place and ended up inviting her family that lived only a short distance away along to stay with her. I couldn't feel better watching them admire the views and beauty of this place. Just knowing that although accustomed to staying in Hotels due to work trips, there was a special emphasis made on returning as Many -Times- Possible, just to enjoy the beauty and tranquility of this paradise and stunning views, Wowed me. I totally recommend this to whom ever has wished for a piece of heaven on earth experience. By the way, totally affordable and a true getaway!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience @ Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: famvargascuevas
Reviews.Content: I thought this is a nice little rustic place to stay. I liked the roughness of the rooms (tiled floors, wicker furniture, spanish-style construction). There was no bathtub in the room we stayed at, but that was no biggie. The water pressure on the room seemed quite low, but I was able to bathe my baby and I after a while. I enjoyed the restaurant and the price included breakfast and dinner, and the food was decent. There are nice hammocks around the property and cute little gazebos and sitting areas to take pictures and admire. My baby enjoyed looking at a big white parrot that was caged near the restaurant. There is also a kiddie pool which is excellent for parents with infants toddlers. My husband enjoyed the lighthouse and beach close to the 'parador'. BEWARE: You really need a car to drive around, as the access to the beach and lighthouse is through a difficult dirt road (you almost need wheel drive to go through, but we were able to make it in our rented sedan). It'll probably take maybe an hour or even more to walk towards the beach through the dirt road. There aren't many other activities other than beach, pool & lighthouse, so I would not recommend staying for more than 3 or 4 days. Also, there aren't any nearby stores to purchase stuff or even to eat. Luckily, the restaurant is decent enough. Overall I would recommend this place for a quick get-away lasting no longer than 4 days. One drawback. Little bugs that pricked us at night made late dinner unpleasant. Other than this, it was an overall pleasant experience for the family. Great place for a quick get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: amypagan
Reviews.Content: we spent three nights at the Bahia Salinas...thank God we rented a Jeep, because it was remote and rough ride but so worth it. It has a romantic feel to it as soon as you enter the gate. I wish they had better enclosed parking but the car was fine and they do lock the gate at night. The pool was an infinity pool face the ocean with the best Sunset we had seen in a long time. We got to eat in their restaurant and the ambiance was superb and so was the food. I was so glad that the room did not have rugs but their decor could have been better the bed cover had stains and I had big issues with the bed. Besides needing more attention to room decor we did enjoy our stay and it was so quiet we slept like babies and we would come back;)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Pleasent”
Reviews.Author: K_Bobe
Reviews.Content: I went to Bahia Salinas for the first time & I have to say, it was very nice, I liked it. Great place for a family with kids or just a couple, only down fall is that it's far from everything, except for the light house & the beach (Playa Sucia). But if your looking for peace & quiet, Bahia Salinas is the way to go. Place is very beautiful, rooms are very spacious and there was always hot water, which is a big plus!! Only thing I would change is the menu. U don't have any selection, u sit down, they bring you what ever they have and rob you $13.50!!! lol.. Well, that was breakfast, I didn't want to try dinner. I guess that's the advantage they have since nothing is around. The staff was very generouse to me, they were very friendly, I had no problem. Other than that, I have no complaints, definitely would go back there again...

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best values I have experienced in 40 countries and over 1 million miles”
Reviews.Author: Kennethdunn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for 3 days. It was amazing. The staff is incredible. The food was awesome. It is a hidden gem. $150 per night included amazing dinners and breakfast. Private beach. Ultimate location to get away from life and relax. Better then Boraki or Cebu or Phuket. Would recommend yo anyone

Reviews.Title: “WILL NOT RECOMMEND TO OUR FRIENDS”
Reviews.Author: pmagat01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not what they advertised. The staff are not friendly and lack inadequate attention to our complaints. We have a few incidents in one of the room, but no one shows up and follow up. The food is....well average. Comapring this place to others we visited in the Dominican Republic, the service is at best at the lowest rung or at the bottom of the barrel. The staff are like zombies, non responsive, barely a smile and sometimes force and contrite. Most of the hotel in the area are the same, the seems to lack the energy to give the ultimate service for the customer. In this place I feel like I owe them something, like its a priviledge to stay in this hotel. As if we are the ones to cater to them rather than the other way around. Asking takes a lot of energy, and if you ask you feel embarrased. There is just to much negative energy on this hotel, I dont feel at eased due the stump personality of the people running this hotel. The only good thing is they have mangrove stink which I like.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful- could be better...”
Reviews.Author: NaomiJimThorpe_PA
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of Bahia Salinas Resort-it was quiet and secluded very romantic. The pool was fantastic and the views incredible. We stayed at the Villa 1 and the view of the ocean was breathtaking. We had the full moon glistening on the bay, They would have gotten and outstanding but they need to work on the customer service. The lady that checked us in was very pleasant, but did not have attention to detail- she stated that my reservation was for one- which was incorrect and neglected to orient us to where the pool towels or the ice was located. I searched for a while until I found another guest who gave me the info. We had snacks at the bar which were OK, service was distressingly slow( I know it was off season and full staff was not expected-but the young man serving appeared overwhelmed and easily taken off task by the number of customes needing attention. This was not an indication to the dinner that we had that evening which was really good. I had the Mahi Mahi with mango sauce and almonds, greek rice and fresh veggies and my husband had the red snapper filet in wine sauce- good portions- good flavors, Wine was reasonably priced. Carlos, our server that night acted as host, waiter, bartender, bus boy and still made it pleasurably to dine there. Kudos to Carlos- I would definitely return- just hope that they look at the feedback as a gift and use it. AC was noisy.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: oddeseys
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Puerto Rico today and felt that I had to write a positive review about this wonderful property. My girlfriend and I spent six wonderful days throughout the island; we had only positive experiences wherever we went but this hotel stood out amongst all the wonderful places we had been. This is not a resort of the type that you might find on the east side of island, which seem to isolate themselves from the natural landscape of the island, but rather a small independently owned parador with a gorgeous view of salinas bay, a beautiful pool, very comfortable rooms, and a friendly and very professional staff. The room was tastefully decorated, with a bed so comfortable I wanted to take it home. The resort itself is located right next to a nature reserve and you could see all manner of sea birds diving for fish while relaxing in the infinity pool. The location is very tranquil, with no noise from cars or nearby settlement. The staff was always smiling and helpful, not in a disney sort of way, but with genuine interest in their work and the comfort of their guests. The food at the restaurant (one of the mesones gastronomicos) was very good and fairly priced. In summation- if you like to be out in nature and aren't an affectionado of package tourism resorts, this is a wonderful place to spend a couple of days. I can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort with amazing wiew.”
Reviews.Author: juankaPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in January in this hotel. I can tell we had a great experience. The hotel has very good ambiance with an excellent infinity pool and a very good restaurant. The rooms are clean and have good size. The air conditioner worked very good as well. We only had a minor inconveneience trying to adjust the temperature of the shower but we managed to deal with it. The area has several of the best beaches in the world. If you are a beach lover, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “unknown gem, beautiful location and out of the chaos of San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: sadiedog
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews of this resort were not good but we stayed here anyway to do recommendations of friends. We are glad we did! This is 3 hours from San Juan and we stayed 4 nights. It is calming and a beautiful destination once you are in Puerto Rico. There is a beach (near lighthouse) about a mile from this hotel whidch is horsehoe shape, remote and beautiful. This beach makes the trip worthwhile. The hotel has a great pool,no problem with bugs (like previous reviews mention). Rooms are clean, not very famcy but more than adequate. Ownersw of this small resort are very friendly. Only comment is I wish the coffee would have been hoter but in thscope of things this is a very min. issue and I would recommend this resort for aminl of 2 nights and max of 4 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away! I Highly Recommend It!”
Reviews.Author: mathteacherts
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Puerto Rico. The first time I went to San Juan and while there, I talked to a local person and she told me that there were so many other beautiful parts of the island that people never see because all the tourists go to San Juan. Was she right!!! I did a lot of research and found this hotel on the southwest tip of the island. I have to say that it was breathtaking. I can't wait to go back and plan on going back too. I'm not sure if I can say the same about San Juan. Just some information about the area....it is very secluded and if you want peace and quiet, this is definitely the place for you. The actual resort area is beautiful and relaxing. The beach is literally 10 feet from the hotel's pool and although you can walk on the beach, it is not recommended to swim in because of the seaweed. If you take a right out of the hotel and drive for about 5 minutes, you will find the most beautiful and secluded beach. It is in the shape of a bay but it still has the beautiful colors of the caribean and is located right by the lighthouse. We went there on Christmas morning and we were literally the only people there and when we returned a few days later, there were people but not many at all and it still had the feeling of seclusion. It is a very very bumpy ride to get there but it is very reachable by car. You will hear that you need a 4-wheel drive to get there but we made it there fine with a Hyuandi Brio. There is another beach located in the opposite direction of the hotel of the hotel in Boqueron (about 15 minutes) but it is nothing like the beach by the lighthouse that I just mentioned. There was a lot of litter and there was a homeless person sleeping on the beach in Boqueron (not that I care about that) but some people may feel uncomfortable about that. The food at the hotel was pretty good but very expensive if you didn't have the meal plan, which we didn't. The breakfast buffet for the two of us was $27 and dinner was $77. We actually ended up driving to Cabo Rojo (about a 20-25 minute drive) and picked our own groceries up and ate mostly from that. There are no refrigerators in the rooms so we had to get food that didn't need to be refrigerated. The rooms were very nice, small, but nice. They were very clean and fine for the two of us. The beds were a little hard and that was really my only complaint about the room. The water pressure in the shower wasn't that great but who cares??? The pool was great! It was big, beautiful and clean. I didn't realize it but there is another pool for kids so that would be great for families but the overall feel of the place was for couples and not families, not saying that there weren't any because there were. This was a great experience and I highly recommend it to anyone. If you're the type of person who is not easy to please or feel that you deserve the best of the best, than this is probably not the place for you. If you're an everyday person who needs some peace and quiet in a beautiful place and don't mind the small rooms than I would go here! Enjoy! Oh, btw, we flew into Ponce, which is about 1 1/2 hours east of it but there is also an airport in Magjuez, north of it. And of course the San Juan airport but that is over 2 hours from it. Ponce was the cheapest for us to fly into. They have several rental car companies right in the airport.

Reviews.Title: “If you like getting mosquito bites, instead of a tan, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: creativeoutlet
Reviews.Content: Not a resort by no means! The pool area is attractive with pretty white couches, and beach chairs and strategically placed awnings for shade as you walked along the pathways, I did appreciate that for the when it rained. However, if you hang around make sure you put on massive amounts of bug spray over your sunscreen. But buyer beware! I was in a King bed room. Before you entered you had to move quickly in the room because the door frame was covered with insects! It had a separate living room. The lighting in the bedroom was extremely dim, annoying. The bathroom had a shower with barely any water pressure. It was decent overall. The living room to me was the worse part.They had a large console table with mirror, that was the nicest thing in the room. I think the couch, if you can call it that was more like a bench, was worn with wicker or bamboo with wood (so called Spanish style furniture). Very uncomfortable, it had dilapidated cushions on a hard surface. A rocking chair, same style. And an old TV set. I didn't have a window in any part of the room. I never felt relaxed except when we left the grounds. WHY you ask! Because I was constantly swatting off mosquitoes! I stayed their four nights, we used the pool once. We ate at the restaurant once, the mosquitos did enjoy their meal more than we did. The waiters and bar tenders were charming, the meal was ok, the lights went out as we waited to pay our tab. The breakfast buffet was cold and not very good especially for Puerto Rico. Every morning I couldn't wait to leave the place. The hotel had a tiny office to check in, etc. I asked a few questions about the area, not very informative. The hotel should supply their guests with bug spray. The best part was the drive to the Cabo Rojo Lighthouse and checking out!

Reviews.Title: “Stressful getaway”
Reviews.Author: Amapola23
Reviews.Content: This is not our first time.But it was our first dissappoitment .The location is beautiful.Our aircondition broke on the second day! In July!! Notify eraly in the morning so they can fix the problem ,it was midnight before they did something about it All day we coolant go inside it was so hot!.nobody to give a straight answer . Spa services Overpriced,had a manicure and pedicure for almost the price of the room,did not even got the massage with it.Good luck if you want something from the bar.Hospitality from the staff is almost none.hopefully they read this reviews and do something to improve.This is a beautiful place but not the only one.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Anita2386
Reviews.Content: The overall service was good. We were received with a candid smile in front desk. At breakfast time the service was a little bit slow. The employees were very friendly. The room was very accomodating, we were place next to the pool and very near the restaurant, it was perfect for us. The furniture is all spanish looking. The resort is small but they have these gazebos all covered in white fabric all over the property which makes it the more romantic. The pool is great and it seems neverending. The service at the Cuni Spa is great they treated me like a queen. They have complimentary coffee in the rooms and the resort is located next to one of the most beautiful beaches in the area "Playa Sucia'' which is gorgeous. It is also close by to Combate and Boqueron which are another two beaches and were you can find lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs”
Reviews.Author: FullMoonSJU
Reviews.Content: Nice facility, clean except for the pool. Beautiful infinity pool with great lounging areas.....but. The water was cloudy, so bad that we didn't go in. Except for the bugs, the restaurant was nice. Buffet breakfast and dinner was good. I had a fish filet with garlic sauce that was delicious. But over priced at $175 a night even with the included meals.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is in a good condition, a good...”
Reviews.Author: nakarieuro
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a good condition, a good place to relax beautifull view of the ocean. However the rooms needs an upgrade to a modern style such as lcd tv. In addition the restaurant requires more variety in the menu. A more lively atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Please pray that you have electricity”
Reviews.Author: diamantenegra
Reviews.Content: Charming,cozy resort in the middle of a luxious facility.Infinity pool and other amenities.We were already planning on returning for future mini vacations. But as I said before KEEP PRAYING THAT YOU ARE LUCKY AND HAVE ELECTRICITY AT ALL TIMES.Our experience is that in the hotel during the day the lights keep going out. Not being able to watch t.v.They have another electric resource that was not working properly.In the evening upon the three prior black out in our room,we went to the front desk, to see what the problem was.We ended up moving all our things in total darkness.We were provided with another room with a different setup, extremely uncomfortable due our minor child, we decided to leave due to the uncomfortable situation.The hotel front clerk was not simpathetic to our situation and told us that if we were not happy with the room she could have given us A SINGLE BED.Their policy is no refund even thought the problem was theires. We had a 3 half hour drive back to the Metropolitan area. II spoke to Mrs.Milexys Rosado the manager /owner and she clearly stated that they were resolving the situation as I explained the inconveniences that we had. No type of customer satisfaction considerations were observed.To make a long story short..FIRST AND LAST MY FRIENDS.......BE AWARE.

Reviews.Title: “What a find - great weeknight rate for romantic and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgbcgb
Reviews.Content: This was my 8th visit to Puerto Rico, and this hotel is less than a mile from my favorite beach on the island. My boyfriend and I had originally planned to road trip around the island, but we stayed here on our 2nd night and loved it so much that we stayed two extra nights. I would say that the majority of the clientele is from PR, so the weekend rates are higher than the weeknight rates. If you stay two or more weeknights, the rate is only $80 per night (with breakfast included). It is a bargain! The rooms are not spectacular, but they are clean and comfortable. The infinity pool is gorgeous and surrounded by beds and lounge chairs. The restaurant and many of the rooms are seaside, and calling ahead will snag you one of the rooms with a private balcony. Dinner at the restaurant was delish! The staff was friendly and warm. There was a spa that I didn't try, but looked quite nice. There isn't much to do around the hotel, but the beach/lighthouse is a long walk or a short, pothole-filled drive down the street. Restaurants and nightlife in La Parguera are about 20-30 minutes away. If you just want to relax in the sun for a few days, Bahia Salinas is a GREAT place to do that. We have already recommended it to anyone who asked about our trip. One suggestion: it would be great if the hotel had some kayaks for their guests to rent or use!

Reviews.Title: “Inifinity pool + Proximity to PR's most beautiful mainland beach + Great food”
Reviews.Author: Eabi
Reviews.Content: Located on the Southwesternmost tip of Puerto Rico, near the Cabo Rojo lighthouse and gorgeous Playa Sucia. This charming parador is a little pricey, but it is an excellent choice if you wish to visit Southwest Puerto Rico, in particular the lighthouse and this beautiful beach. The pool area is beautiful and clean, with lots of nice furniture. More kids running around the pool during the day that I'd like, but the hotel was nice and quiet at night. Must bring insect repellent like Off, as there are plenty of mosquitoes around because the hotel is smack in the middle of a wildlife refuge, surrounded by mangrove. I stayed in a villa, and the room was decent. Was not impressed by size of bathtub, but other than that, no complaints. If you're interested in nightlife, you'll definitely need a car. Friendly service throught out the hotel, from check-in to check-out. I'd stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Romantic, Secluded”
Reviews.Author: CutiepiePR
Reviews.Content: The location is tucked away in a secluded spot on the southwesternmost tip of the Island. It's a bit difficult to find, our gps had us going around in circles. We ended up finding it asking the locals. Our room was rather small, and the air conditioning wasn't cooling the room properly, Other than that, the hotel is lovely. The staff is very nice, friendly and attentive. The pool area is just beautiful. We found that the price is on the high end. Our package included breakfast (which we didn't get up in time for), dinner, and two complimentary local rum drinks. The dinner was ok, I recommend ordering the Chillo with Salsa Criolla, yummy. We ended up paying 365$ for two nights. If you want to order drinks at the bar...be prepared to spend a hefty amount... However, the spectacular view of the Caribbean Sea, the beautiful infinity pool, the lovely Sunsets, and the Cabo Rojo lighthouse in the distance makes up for the downfalls. I would recommend the hotel to couples looking to spend a romantic, relaxing and secluded weekend. It really is breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS UNIQUE AN AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: ladyazy
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place in Cabo Rojo, Its very nice and clean. The pool is absolutely beautiful and relaxing, the restaurant, "Con el Agua al Cuello"is excellent, great food, great service. I will return as soon as possible with my boyfriend, maybe we will marry here (who knows), I recommend this 110%. If you want to have a unique and romantic experience this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “So great we stayed more days than we planned”
Reviews.Author: megwr
Reviews.Content: My husband and i staed here last month --it was great, we stayed 2 extra nights. They had a great weekday rate of $81 including tax and a sumptuous buffet breakfast. We raraly needed lunch. Down the potholed unpaved road to the faro(lighthouse) lies what is to me the loveliest beach in Puerto Rico, clean, wavey but protected by a reef, enclosed withing a cove of high red cliffs. looks like a Monet in Brittany painting. We had to walk the last 1/2 mile as our car could not manage the holes. There are large sea grape trees for shelter from the sun. No facilities-bring water food etc. pack it out pack it in. The hotel had a great pool overlooking the ocean--it gave the illusion of flowing right into the sea. Beautiful sunsets. On clear nights the stars wrere great. The rooms were fine, comfortable. No one would go to stay inside. The dinner menu was fusion, I guess. mofongo stuffed with squid in a mushroon wine sauce. That was a little weird. if you want more typical food, you could eat in Combate or even Joyuda. This was a very relaxing pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: califun019
Reviews.Content: We stay for weekend during Christmas at a great price. I love the location because is so close to one of the most beautiful beaches in Puerto Rico and far away from everything else. The staff was really friendly and the pool is awesome. The place is really quite and nice. Love the hammocks and the rocking chairs! The furniture at the pool is great and really comfy! Breakfast was good, never really tried the restaurant. Had some trouble with the internet, and the bathrooms could use a remodel. Besides that, I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Old and expensive...owner does not care.”
Reviews.Author: rman971
Reviews.Content: The setting is beautiful other than the odor from the mangrove but that is understandable. The hotel is old and run down and they charge like you were in a 4 star resort. The pool was always cloudy and the room was awful complained about the bed spring various times always the same answer, the resort is full, even though it did not seem to be many people walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced under-performing old parador under new title”
Reviews.Author: PallidinMinnesota
Reviews.Content: An absolute rip-off! An over-priced, over-marketed, poor-on-delivery old parador under new management hoping to pull the wool over the public! At $250/night, it was underwhelming and extremely disappointing. The formerly free, open and warm mineral bath is now $25.00 for 25 minutes, COLD, and enclosed in four walls and the obviously untrained and non-certified massage therapist ushered us out after only 15 minutes! Her massage at $75.00/hour/person was nothing more than pouring lots of oil on our skin and lightly rubbing it for only 35 minutes in a very cold room which we were happy to leave. While this "spa" promoted "one towel per person for the swimming pool," for each of our three days there, they could never supply more than one. "Meals included" was nothing more than a $12.00/dinner/person allowance against much higher prices and a breakfast allowance of $5.00/person -- we paid an expensive net for otherwise plain ordinary Puerto Rican food -- albeit well-prepared. Our second floor tiny room "overlooking the ocean" consisted of one queen bed, ONE chair, two uncomfortable aluminum lawn chairs on a narrow "deck", a noisy air conditioner, a fuzzy picture TV and an ill-fitting "fitted" sheet that we had to continually readjust throughout the nights. The two free drink coupons yielded cheap drinks from a very limited menu. For dinner entertainment, they played a televised DVD like a "broken record," that they kept forgetting to re-set and played so loud we needed ear plugs to have a quiet dinner. A lousy excuse for a Spa in a beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Spa is an imposter”
Reviews.Author: Fabbiola
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the spa only. Six of us visited the spa and had a variety of services. The visit was a mess from the time we check in until we finished the last service. Now I know why you have to prepay for the services, because after the first service, we would have left. The checkin was a disaster and it took 30 minutes just to get straight the services we wanted and got the receipt to go and pay for them. We had two spanish speakers so that wasn't the problem. Stay out of the mineral bath--filled with bugs. The treatment rooms were freezing and one of the technicians had clearly not been trained as a masseuse. She was only interested in making sure we had tipped her, and whether we could buy products, and telling us she gave us extra treatments, looking for more tips. No blankets in the massage treatment wrrooms, only BEACH TOWELS. During one massage, when a client was laying pretty naked (which should never happen with a proper massage), someone came in to talk to the technician and they carried on a conversation with the door open! They clearly don't know what a real spa is and the way services should be performed. We do not need constant chatter during the facials and massages. This spa is an imposter. Very expensive. The only positive was the beautiful setting at the pool, waiting for our services. The lunch was only adequate and there was not a bartender at the bar. Service is just lacking everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place horrible food what had happened?"”
Reviews.Author: lothebeach
Reviews.Content: I visited this magical place about 5 month ago with some friends. The spa was huge for such a little hotel. The pool was beautiful and the restaurant was an eclectic style look with a weird taste, there I remembered being attended by a very kind waiter with green eyes:) I think his name was Jowel great Food ,the service was amazing i even order prior to the dinner time attended by a young lady chef who was very helpful and kind , great atmosphere the bugs didn't seems to bather me at all, it is part of vacationing near the beach area. But this past weekend i decided to spend this short vacations with my husband there and that lovely experience turned into a nightmare. The bugs did bother me this time, The food either was under cook or overcooked (burned) it took to long the service was rushed and unpleasant the cuality of the menu had changed to a lesser one ,i asked who was the chef of the night to make a request to that young lady I met, but to my surprised she no longer works there " no wonders" After waiting more than an hour i finally ate some i decided to go to the pool for a walk but the bugs and he smell of chlorine made me go back to my room . I have to say they save the weekend bu giving us a buffet night for next day, basically the same menu but buffet style . I still recomend this place but It is a great place to spend the day but at night you better find someplace else to go!

Reviews.Title: “Photos are very deceiving.”
Reviews.Author: source0105
Reviews.Content: Photos of "beautiful" beaches and paradores can be very deceiving. They actually look great from a distance. However, when you get there, you encounter very different realities. First, beaches are not as pristinely clean as in the photos. Beaches are rather murky and sometimes dirty with fishy smells, and so infested with gnats and mosquitos galore that you will get "eaten" alive. Make sure to bring a lot of bug repellant, (i.e., Off). Second, Bahia Salinas where we stayed is nicely landscaped and decorated, but we wondered where the "restaurants" are, if any. We had to have a dinner at Bahia Salinas' restaurant as there were no other alternatives around Cabo Rojo. Not only was the food expensive but it was extremely salty to our palate. This is not a place to return to. Just enjoy in the comfort of your home how beautiful Cabo Rojo looks in the Que Pasa magazine.

Reviews.Title: “This place is unique, great, awesome...a must stay!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: xjfan
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews, we were kind some hesitant and took a chance. Boy was it worth the long drive from the airport. This location is far away from the fast paced city, itâ€™s laid back, calm, quietâ€¦. Just what we were looking for on our vacation. This place has the feel of a very luxurious resort and at less that $100 per night, it was a bargain. The current special helped a lot. We stayed 2 nights. The first night was a late arrival, right at dusk. After checked in, we could not believe how beautiful this location was. Words of caution, once the sun goes down the mosquitoes are ferocious. We did not have an repellant on and eating outside was miserable. The next day we bought a can of OFF took care of that. At night we would just lay down on the large soft that around the pool and stared at the moon and stars for a long time. It was unforgettable. Dinner We were given a 10% off coupon for dinner at the restaurant. The first night after our arrival, we ate at the restaurant, the food was ok. I only had an appetizer. The second night we drove to El Combate and ate at Annieâ€™s Place. Itâ€™s very close and the food is great. Breakfast We purchased the breakfast buffet. The cost for the breakfast was more expensive than what we would have like to pay but worth it. The breakfast was awesome, delicious. Make sure you get to the buffet at least 30 minutes before it closes. If not, your selection will be limitedâ€¦ Nearby Beach Make sure you first buy a cooler, drinks, sun block and whatever else you think you might need. A drive to El Combate and youâ€™ll be able to find everything. A 5 minute drive on the dirt road from the hotel and your at Playa Sucia. During the weekday, hardly no-one was there. It was as if we had the beach to ourselves. The water was warm and calm. Shade was very close to the water and the view was excellent. There is also a Light House next to the beach, itâ€™s a must visit. We parked next to the gate and walked up the hill to the light house then continued on to the beach. Have fun and enjoyâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: RMachargo
Reviews.Content: We arrived before midnight. It was magical, the harbor waters were as calm as a lake, the moon was reflected on the bay and the reflection continued on to the infinity edge pool. All that combined with the quiet sea breeze and the sky full os stars made the experience eerie but in a good way. The staff was very hepfull the even stayed on the phone giving us directions how to get there close to midnight.. The room was clean and traditionally decorated. The pool was idilyc. A short drive away is Playa Sucia one of the most beatifull beaches in Puerto Rico and the wildlife reseve. We left wanting more and pledging ourselves to return.

Reviews.Title: “Guest are looking for good service and empathy too bad owner does not provide it”
Reviews.Author: mortiz971
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to go relax and be served since I was on vacation from a long year of hard work and decided to try Bahia Salinas which seemed liked the ideal place, atleast on the internet site it did. First, what you see on site is not exactly what you find. I expected better service including someone to order cocktails from while relaxing on the pool area. Additional to this we had a customer service issue which the owner , Miguel Rosado attended. Mr.Rosado had no empathy and no sense of making us feel as if his guest were a priority for him. He basically turned his back on me and went into an office without even trying to fix the situation. In these times of bad economy and always every business should have there customer as a priority. I have never experienced a situation wher management or the owner of an establisment has not tried to go out of his way to resolve the situation. I personally will NEVER return to Bahia Salinas and I do not recommend it either.

Reviews.Title: “Romantically hidden”
Reviews.Author: ICHIEPOO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for our honeymoon. To us, we had the best room in the resort because it was over looking the pool and ocean. Every time we sat on the balcony, the view made romance even more romantic. To swim in the pool and have the ocean just feets away is very beautiful. The service through out the resort was on the money. At the resturant i had octapus in monfongo and the sauce was one of the best i ever had. Thank you Bahia Salinas owner and staff for making my honeymoon a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “it was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: stumpycat
Reviews.Content: We have returned to Bahia Salinas for several years, almost ten years by now. Each year we have enjoyed new features in the resort. During iour last visit in March 09 we specially enjoyed breakfast in the beuatiful outdor restaurant with the friendly cooks and staff. They made breakfast a fun meal and added to our enjoyment of the visit. Bahia Salinas' location is great

Reviews.Title: “More of a resort than a parador”
Reviews.Author: RoseAlee
Reviews.Content: Last December American Airlines had a $250 Austin/San Juan round trip special that we couldn't pass up and pushed the "Buy" button! I mentioned the cheap airfare and our friends (other retirees) said "we're in". With a little research we decided to circumnavigate the island staying at paradors and sample the fine Porto Rican food and the rums. What a great idea! I booked our rooms via Orbitz.com at $131+tax/room/night. We were assigned rooms 104 and 105 just like the first parador. Cabo Rojo was our second stop. These rooms were centrally located and on the second floor overlooking the bay. This place has three pools and workout facilities. The "girls' got massages and the "guys" got extra rum. Everyone at the Bahia Salinas was very friendly and helpful. All of the other guests were from Porto Rico. The food was excellent and the cook came around "forcing us" to sample some of her creations. I resisted - Not. There is not a lot happening around the area, so be prepared for a quiet stay. There is s small sheltered beach further down the road and the light house is interesting. If I had it to do over, I would have spent a couple of extra days here and go to the phosphorescent Bay of La Parguera. We were told that a major renovation was about to start that would greatly expand the size of the Resort - Too bad I think.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting, great decor, so-so service, awful room, terrible prices”
Reviews.Author: demf
Reviews.Content: I stayed over a weekend, with my wife. We took a package that gave you 3d/2n with dinners and breakfasts for $425, from which you could deduct $75 with a discount offered by the Paradores de Puerto Rico website. Service is corteous (all young), but sometimes a bit intrusive. *Everything* is rationed: from the ice, to the dinner rolls, to the food portions (the food is extremely good, to be fair), to the rooms (ours was tiny; you literally had to squeeze yourself through the front of the bed to reach the extremely noisy A/C and the other side.) In theory, there could be surcharges for everything, from moving a bed, to returning towels outside of a time window... you feel like you're in summons, and not a guest. Then, there are the surprises: you're offered soup as part of a dinner, but they won't tell you they'll charge $6 for each soup bowl, until you get surprised at the end... The ambiance and decor is lovely in the outside (the big pool looks like something out of Town and Country magazine), short of spectacular (they're in the middle of a wildlife preserve, truly blessed when it comes to location), but the rooms leave much to be desired. I found a cockroach in the bathroom, the floor tiles were a bit gritty, and the bed's linens deserved a throught cleaning. Yuck. The prices do not reflect the value offered. One could forgive the small rooms if they were better kept and more hygienic; the food tastes great but if you take the package, you're limited to the same six options all through your stay. The setting is great, but decor and location do not a hotel make... I'm being generous with the rating since everybody there appears to be friendly and receptive to criticism, but it charges 4-star prices for 2-star service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to be a real "paradise".”
Reviews.Author: PuertoRicoDomingo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for our 30 wedding aniversary and we spent three magnifficient days! The ownners special attention made us feel like kings.The rooms are in excellent conditions,the pool's are very clean and beatifull,and the food and service at the restaurant ,"fabulous"! The good service and the excellent attentions we received and the beatifull view at this hotel is by far our next choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Not For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: lynsk
Reviews.Content: Situated in a Nature Preserve on the SW tip of PR, Bahia Salinas is uniquely special for its isolation and location. We spent four nights here in the middle of July. The pool is beautiful. Our room on the second floor was small though pretty. We had no problems with the hot water and the bed was extremely comfortable. We found the staff to be friendly and accomodating. The reasons I write that it's not for everyone are as follows: 1) The "resort" is on a really narrow strip of property. Since there wasn't much property to care for, I felt that what was there could have been better maintained. 2) The pool, which is beautiful, closes at 7:00 - why? There is nothing else to do here. 3) Since the hotel is in a nature preserve, they are not allowed to spray for mosquitoes, gnats, ect. We ate at the beach side restaurant on our first night and were driven inside by swarms of gnats who ended up swimming in our wine. We were glad we did not opt for the meal plan since we never ate there again. 4) I was sure that breakfast was included in our room rate but was told upon arrival that breakfast was not included. We ate at Mary's bakery every day right down the street. Which brings me to 5) The Rate. We paid about $170 a night - no breakfast incuded. In my opinion - way overpriced. The overall experience of this hotel and surrounding sites was good. There is some good birding to be done on the salt flats. I'm glad we went, but would probably not return to Bahia Salinas Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in HELL”
Reviews.Author: traveler-hobby
Reviews.Content: The place and service was a terrible since we got there. IT IS NOT HOT WATER. The tiles of the rooms they were black from the dirt. One of the moms in the group makes a reservation for 2 rooms and they never book it. The hotel where expecting that the pregnant lady sleep with her husband and 2 kids in one bed because was too late to resolved the issue. The service at the restaurant was terrible. Hold on what service?????????? It is no service .We wait for over one hour just for some of the drinks. It is no real beach in that resort. It is a mangrove. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone I know. NEVER. The worse part it is that we talk to the owner about the issue and he just tells us that was our opinion. With a management like that I can't speck anything better from the people that work there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Judge a Book by its Cover”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinHappy4
Reviews.Content: This place was terrible from the inside out! We paid way too much money for what we got. Our room was horrible, beds uncomfortable, we didn't get hot water and even had a lizard in our bathroom and it was not much for a romantic getaway when they put your room in front of the kiddie pool- so at 8am we were woken up to kids screaming. We had brought snorkle gear since they said there would be a place to snorkle, but there was no place to go and the place recommended by the front desk staff was horrible. We couldn't even go in front of the hotel because it was pure muck. They did give us a new room after we found the lizard in our bathroom, but it wasn't much of a difference except we had hot water and no more lizards. We were going to rent a kayak, but there was never anyone there to help us get the boats- you have to call a number off site to gain access to them. It was a good thing my husband and I didn't bring our two small children because there was a mass of bees by the kiddie pool and over 30 dead bees floating in the kiddie pool. We CAN NOT believe the same pictures on the website were actually taken at this hotel. The breakfast wasn't bad, but for 200+ dollars a night it should have been better- everything should have been better. If all you want to do is sit by a pool and read a book and occaisionally look out over the ocean and pay $200/ night- this is the place for you. I feel bad being so critical- but the place was truley terrible and we hope you don't make the same mistake we did by going there- we would not have wriiten this review if they charged $60/night and were honest with their website and what they had to offer. The staff was nice for the most part, but we will NOT be returning or encouraging anyone to go there.

Reviews.Title: “ZERO hot water, stinks”
Reviews.Author: brookej79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the street from the salt flats and stinks like decaying fish. Depending on what room you are in, you can smell the stench in your room! Also, there was no hot water ever! When I asked the front desk they told me to let the water run for a few minutes and it would get hot. We let it run 30 minutes and it never got hot. So the next morning I thought surely we would have hot water but unfortunately it was the same situation. When you eat breakfast at the hotel be prepared to have at least 1 or 2 of the half starved stray dogs stare are you with longing for scraps. The only good things at this hotel was the comfortable bed and the pools and grounds were very pretty. The setting is nice except for the stink of the salt flats.

Reviews.Title: “The office staff 'misplaced' [stole] my daughter's phone!”
Reviews.Author: tropicalgardener
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE FRIEND...READ ON, Where do I start with this overpriced dump? First, my daughter left her bookbag in the office upon checkout. When we called, nobody knew about the bag. We called again. Oh, the bag was found. Was the cell phone with the bag? Yes. Could you please mail it to us and bill our room? Certainly. Waited a week, called. Woman said she could not mail without charge card number. I politely told her to use the one her business used to charge our room. Waited a week more, nothing. Called, she claimed Federal Express had not come by. Frustrated, I drove for two hours across the island to pick up the bag myself. When I got there, the phone was missing, though two of the female employees had seen the phone, safe behind the office desk. Nobody could say where the phone was since "anything was possible!" The manager/owner was, naturally, on a trip to San Juan. We left. I have been calling for over two weeks now. In the U.S. I would have called the police. What a nasty experience. This hotel owner has no moral, no standards, no class. I wish I could report him to...someone. Truth is: In Puerto Rico, Americans get ripped off on the regular-even by so-called "nice" places like this moth-bug infested hellhole. Second, you can't go in the water because it is...toxic. Really, you cannot go in the bug-infested water in front the the "spa" because it contains dangerous microbes, too near the mangrove and salt flats. The water stinks and is murky. We paid way too much for our nasty room. I woke up with hotel throat, though the place is supposed to be some sort of spa. For the same price, in Mexico, you can stay in a "truly" wonderful hotel. Not this dump. Guess what: we should have known better. We checked in on a weekday, thought at the height of the tourist season-not another guest the whole time. The manager glared at my well-behaved children splashing in the deserted pool. It was clear the place was structured for the singles set, or honeymooners. I cannot imagine spending a honeymoon in this dump. The truth is this: If you took this place and set it down in an area not infested with bugs and crawling, slimy things, it might be kind of nice. But then you would still have the surly workers, and dishonest management/owner. When we checked in, the woman acted as if we were disturbing some great moment. But this is typical of the Puerto Rican hotel workers; they obviously hate their jobs and could give a rat's butt about customers. The salt flats are very interesting, if a bit deserted and not safe for families. The local beaches are really quite wonderful, but I would perhaps stay in Rincon next time-which I usually do. This place has bad vibes, and I am guessing it starts with the owner. By the way, for the prices you pay, the restaurant kind of sucks, too, and the service is lame. Again, you would be better off heading to Rincon. I call every day, but the manager/owner refuses to return my calls. Maybe the workers are not giving him the message? Welcome to Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Negrito69
Reviews.Content: It is truly a hidden treasure. The setting in which this hotel is located is extracted direct from a travel magazine, I had the opportunity of seeing the most beautiful sunset from the hotel's infinity pool. The hotel's restuarant, which has a huge deck overlooking the ocean, is above par and has a nice selection of fresh seafood. Anythiong you order you must order "a la Salina's", the restaurants special suace, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery! Lousy Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: The_Travelmeister
Reviews.Content: We just finished our stay at Bahia Salinas, and would really not consider staying again unless certain changes are made to the hotel and the staff. Bahia Salinas' location, on the southwest tip of Puerto Rico, is beautiful. It's a serene environment, with mangroves, and a nearby lighthouse and beach, as well as a nature preserve. Sunsets across the ocean are goregus, and the dark night skies are great for watching the stars (just bring lots of mosquito repellant or be prepared to be eaten alive). The hotel, billed as an upscale boutique hotel, leaves much to be desired. The rooms are small and rather spartan (bed, AC/TV, and not much else), some with small or nonexistent windows. What really got to me was the fact that in the morning we had no hot water. Argh! I'm paying $170 per night to have NO HOT WATER??? When we complained at the front desk, we were told that the hotel's water heater was solar powered. Oh.... so on cloudy days... no hot water? To top it off, the front desk's attitude was unapologetic, take it or leave it, as if to say, there's lot's of other people who want to stay here besides you, we're doing YOU a favor by letting you stay here. To be fair, the hotel pool is great and the landscaping tasteful. The restaurant food was overpriced, but good. So overall, the stay was wonderful, so long as we stayed OUTSIDE our room. The rooms and staffing attitude have to be brought up to par with the price! Next time we travel down to southwestern Puerto Rico we'll go enjoy the scenery, perhaps have dinner while enjoying the sunset, but head elsewhere to lodge. There are several places to stay along the coast. In la Parguera (Lajas) there are several cheap hotels. There's a "parador hotel" called Villa Parguera which is excellent (and half the price). A little further east in Guanica you can also find Copamarina Resort. It's more expensive than VIlla Parguera, but more peaceful and secluded.

Reviews.Title: “A mistake that cost too much”
Reviews.Author: corion
Reviews.Content: I traveled from Charlotte NC to meet a wonderful lovely woman. The resort Bahia Salinas was very expensive for what they offer. The highest they should charge is $110 not over $200 per night. The room was very small no amenities. Bathroom was small , with a small sink. The pool was nice, but they close pool at 7pm. The restaurant was nice friendly people and good food. The mayor problem at the restaurant was too many ants running all over the tables and they have nothing to control that. Bring your mosquito spray they will eat you before you finish your food. There is nothing to do beside staying in your room or in the pool. What made this trip a good experience was the the beautiful girl I went to meet. I would not go back or recommend this resort to anyone. They need to improve..too bad they don't read the reviews to improve.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: karyn_carlo
Reviews.Content: the decor and landscaping is lovely and the staff is friendly, BUT be aware that 1. you cannot swim here! it is a shallow mangrove swamp. there are swimming places nearby, but not at the resort itself 2. not all rooms are spacious with balconies as described. we got stuck in a cramped room with windows opening onto a wall! 3. the food is good, but the service is slllllooowwwww, like 40 minutes to an hour to get a hamburger. the prices are on the high end for paradores. we have stayed in much nicer ones for less. all in all, I would recommend the place, but with serious reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: pabcbc
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights mid-week in June with my family in two rooms (next to each other in front of the kids' pool). I say mid-week and it is important because (this was my first stay in PR) I now understand that resorts and resort towns are completely dead during the week and get busy at the week end. So we had the resort for ourselves and it was great. The resort is between the salt flats (in exploitation) and the sea. The beach is swampy but the view is to die for. There are nice beaches on both sides (accessible by car or walking), bring your bug spray. The view from the cliffs and the lighthouse are great. There is not much to do in the hotel (this is not really a resort, kayaks and ping pong tables would not hurt), it is remote and relaxing. Service is friendly. Staff finds it difficult to get out of the routine, but the routine is good enough. Food in the evening is good if the chef is in good mood and does not want to close the kitchen too early (again, mid-week). Go to Joyuda Beach or La Parguera for more choice. The peninsula on which the hotel sits is just incredible for jogging, cycling or walking in a nature preserve. The rooms are big (ours had no phone). Next year they plan to add 38 villas, it could get more crowded. All in all, this is a Parador, inexpensive for what you get, in the middle of the most incredible nature settings in PR.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: ginorio
Reviews.Content: We figure this innocent looking hotel was the right place to have our wedding. It turn out to be a disaster. After signing a contract 4 months ahead and numerous inconclusive phone calls , they changed all the terms without taking any consideration on our part or the 125 guest. The tried to CRASH our wedding. Being small cheap in the middle of no ware, we though a situation like this wouldnâ€™t happen there. We pick this little hotel because of sentimental value, not for real value. We as residents of PR really know our turf . As love birds we use to spend a lot of time in the Cabo Rojo restaurant & beaches areas. We pick this hotel even though it doesnâ€™t have a beach in the resort. They promote â€œbeach weddingsâ€� but in reality are â€œswamp weddingsâ€� There is a immense mangroo swamp lagoon on the back side of the hotel and a abandoned salt processing plant to the front. The nearest beach is about 35 min hike on a secluded pathway.( Check the area in satellite Google maps). Caution be a wear of stray dogs, mosquitoes and bad people in the area. Cheap things turn to be the most expensive ones. Thankfully there are plenty of options here. Now we are very exited to have our wedding in Rincon in four star resort. Please save you and your love ones a disaster like this keep away from this TOURIST TRAP. Xiomara & Angel Luis

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Will return”
Reviews.Author: dchatt1a
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March and I loved every minute. This is a great place to just relax, watch the sun rise and the sun set (both of which are phenomenal). I discovered this hotel last year when I was trying to get to the light house. Getting there may be confusing. The easiest way of getteing to the hotel is probably Highway 2 to road 100 then 301 all the way to the end. The hotel is located in a wildlife sanctuary and close to an area where sea salt is produced (there will not be any noise to bother you). As you pass these the road will appear to seem to end, since there will be large pot holes, but go slowly and you will encounter the hotel. (the reason for not repairing the pot holes I was told by the wildlife people is to control access to the area. If the road was pristine they say many more people would enter the refuge. Once you see the beauty you will probably agree). The restaurant serves good food, the service is friendly but slow. Order a medalla or other drink while you watch the sunset. Ask for the bread with papaya flavored butter. The fried red snapper, the snapper fillet, and the mofongo (mashed plaintain with garlic stuffed with whatever you want) are excellent and well worth the wait. On the weekend they had a guitar player who played great music during dinner. The pool was nice, but there is no beach on the property. However, there is a beach, a lighthouse and hiking for those willing to bring water and food, get into their car and drive further along the road with the pot holes. As you drive the road will fork, on the right you will encounter the path leading to the beautiful light house and cliffs overlooking the ocean (be careful with the edge of the cliffs since the edges may lack support). The wind is great for flying a kite (save the one that you might have used at El Morro in San Juan). From the light house you will be able to see Playa Sucia (it is unclear why they call it sucia- dirty in English. I was told two stories; 1. the ocean brings up the garbage from the cruise liners and the surrounding islands, 2. the seaweed washing up makes the beach look dirty.) If you go back to your car, take the left portion of the fork in the road, the pot holes here are larger than the previous one you may have encountered, but drive courteously and carefully and you will reach the beach, which is great, clean and pristine. Parts of it are rocky, but there are areas where you can get in the water without problems. If you walk to the end of the beach there will be some hiking trails, I did not go because my significant other would not let me. However, there were many people there. The room at the hotel was nice, there was a small balcony where I would sit outside at night, read and drink a beer. You could also sit by the pool at night and feel the breeze. At night we would sleep with the door open so that we could hear the coqui, and there was never a problem. For breakfast, we would go into town to try the local food and it was well worth it. This place is well worth going to if you just want to relax, and enjoy the surroundings. I will certainly return, and would recommend this place to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Check your”
Reviews.Author: ricktap
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anybody. The time you wait for your food is mind boggling. It takes hours just to get your order on the table. The place stink like hell..........coming from the shallow beach front...do they have one really?.........The employees have the premium parking space. I park once inside and they chase me away....as if I was some local who happen to sightsee. The pool is nice...but nothing like the Frenchman Reef Hotel in St. Thomas. It was an ordinary pool nothing to be proud off. The spa? nothing fantastic and awesome....I will not trade it for The Golden Door Spa in Hotel Conquistador. I was treated like a real paying custumer there. The spa offer is basic and redundant. I can go to any beauty saloon and they offer a much better bargain for it. The beach front? Cant swim! Can use the water it is infested with mosquitos and jelly fish. Food is good and tasty but nothing superb like the Rincon By the Seas. This Resort I highly Recommended due to their professionalism and promt service when ordering your meals. They are very good and attentive to your needs. And the food is excellent. Bahia Salina is good for people who are looking for a resort who want to sacrifice convinient. From the dark and damp rooms, to a restaurant in which a meal takes a lifetime to be serve and the smelly water from its beach front (specially in the Morning and Late afternoon...EWWWW). Mosquitos? They are plentiful...I ask them if they can lit up a citronella candle and the response was....that I have to live with them since they are part of the package. I almost blew my top....helllllloooooo!....horses! Mosquitos!?......This place isnot for people who are pinicky and have been to hotels and have their needs taken care off without asking for it. I do have one good experience with one nice gorgeous lady there at bahia Salinas.......and she is not human.....she is the Parrot they called Chalina. LOL

HotelInfo.Name: Bahia Salinas Beach Resort & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: Carr 301 Km 11, Cabo Rojo 00622, Puerto Rico
